title: COVID19 Cancelled Wedding Changes To A Beautifully Intimate Micro Ceremony
text:
By Louise Baltruschat Hollis
Unexpected, not as planned but still the best day of our lives!
Faye and Niall
Their day may have been short and sweet, but it was certainly full of heart. WWW readers Faye and Niall were due to host their wedding on the 21st March 2020, sadly their venue understandably cancelled their reception the night before, after they had checked into the venue on the Friday night. COVID19 meant that their dream day had to be cancelled and their intimate micro wedding ceremony took place just before the lockdown restrictions in the UK were put into place. My heart really goes out to these two and their loved ones, what an awfully heartbreaking moment for them, especially the night before their big day. But what troopers they are, they seized the day, embraced the situation and went ahead with their beautiful ceremony regardless. Inspirational indeed!
These images kindly sent to me by Carn Patrick clearly demonstrate how much love and affection was in the air. Smiles from ear to ear and beautiful touches and attire all round were captured so beautifully. I adore Faye‚Äôs elegant gown and Niall‚Äôs kilt and the bountiful bridal bouquet. If their ceremony is anything to go by, their reception when it takes place when wedding restrictions here in the UK are lifted, is sure to be spectacular! If you can take anything from Faye and Niall‚Äôs experience it‚Äôs to be sure to remember that your wedding is about the two of you and the beginning of your marriage. After all that‚Äôs all that really matters, the love.
I moved to Scotland in Summer 2014 and met Niall in the Autumn that year. We love walking in the hills in Aberdeenshire and that‚Äôs where he proposed on 9th February 2018. We were on a hill completely alone and it was perfect. He knew if he had planned something different to our usual walks I‚Äôd have definitely guessed that something was going on üòâ
We wanted a classic wedding with a mix of Scottish and English traditions and features. From thistles in the flowers, to a traditional English church to a Ceilidh band at the evening reception.
We loved every part of the planning process! From the cake tasting to the church visits, however all the planning in the world couldn‚Äôt have stopped our ‚Äúdream‚Äù wedding being changed to something completely different due to our venue understandably cancelling the night before our wedding because of Covid-19.
Valerie Rose ‚Äì they were perfect. I couldn‚Äôt stop crying when I saw my bouquet!
25, 000
Wynyard Hall, Billingham on Tees (or that‚Äôs where we will have our celebration once all this isolation is over with!).
Changed to ‚Äì Thorpe Thewles church and my parents house for a mini celebration!
Unfortunately we couldn‚Äôt have any! It was a very simple ceremony and we still managed to have the bells at the church rung for us when we left.
The Designer Cake Company ‚Äì four tiers of caramel apple, chocolate orange and white chocolate lemon and blueberry.
Carn Patrick ‚Äì Carn was unbelievable. Especially with such drastic changes last minute. He made sure he captured so many photos of our altered ceremony. By looking at them you can‚Äôt tell it wasn‚Äôt an ordinary wedding!
Once our celebration can happen we will be able to give out our favours and have all the details that we so wanted on the day at Wynyard Hall. We have beautiful stationery made by Rosewood Co that I can‚Äôt wait to use!
My dress was a simple Pronovias Atelier dress made from crepe with slight beading on the neckline. My Mam chose it for me to try on as she thought it best suited me‚Ä¶ turns out she was right! I bought it from Perfect Bridal Rooms in Aberdeen which is close to where Niall and I live for easier fittings! My shoes were Jimmy Choo and earrings were from Latelita.
Niall‚Äôs kilt is his Sutherland tartan and his jacket and accessories are from Georgian Dress Hire also in Aberdeen.
Hair colour ‚Äì Rob Smith at The Copper House, Middlesbrough
Hair up ‚Äì Carly Taylor Bridal Hair
Make Up ‚Äì Heather Francesca Make Up Studio
Nails ‚Äì Nails by Kate Olivia
To be confirmed! We had booked to go to America in June 2020‚Ä¶.hopefully this can still go ahead but we‚Äôve become the masters of adapting!!
There were meant to be five groomsmen but due to restrictions on the day only my younger brother could be in the church! He wore a kilt also by Georgian Dress Hire.
Again there were meant to be five bridesmaids but Niall‚Äôs older sister could be our only one in the church. Her dress was a sage green pleated halter neck dress by Oasis.
Being married in front of just our immediate family wasn‚Äôt what we expected but it somehow made it feel so special.
Don‚Äôt sweat the small stuff honestly! Once our venue had cancelled on us it became so clear that all we wanted to do was marry each other and nothing else seemed to matter!

Wow, what an emotional and very special story. How fantastic of the local vicar to step in last minute too! It‚Äôs lovely to see that some other loved ones were able to pop by for their confetti moment post ceremony.
Faye and Niall I cannot thank you enough for kindly sharing your really beautiful wedding day. I am really excited to see how your reception turns out when it happens and that you also have the most wonderful honeymoon when you are able to. I have a funny feeling it‚Äôs going to be a really incredible celebration xo Lou
